title: Sewing Case, 1800–50
medium:
Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: sewn from printed plain weave
description: Oblong case, made to fold or roll, with five pockets and a red flannel flap at the top for needles. Three patterns of printed cotton back a single piece if brown block design on a stippled ground; pockets of dark red and green patterned cottons. Remains of a gold taffeta ribbon tie, with the inscription in black: Reina Victoria, with the shield of Britain, with lion and unicorn.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sewing Case, 1800–50. Medium: cotton, wool
Technique: sewn from printed plain weave. 1954-78-1.
